Recipe.title: Garlic-Ginger Stir-Fry Green Beans
Recipe.Description:
One day Di wanted some oriental style green beans. We tried a few recipes and each had some good and bad to them, so we started experimenting. Each time we found one thing that wasn't right, so we would adjust that, then something else would stand out.
After many attempts we finally came up with this recipe that is just right for us.
NOTE: Later on, Di decided she doesn't want Ginger in it, but the rest of us Love it

ingredient.name: Ginger
ingredient.amountNote: Unless Di says to not use it. &smiley;

section.instruction: In a small cup combine Crushed Red Chili Pepper Flakes, Ginger, Chili Sauce, Soy Sauce, Rice Wine Vinegar, Sesame Oil and Water. Stir well and set aside.
Wash Green Beans and remove all stems from them.
In a wok, add Vegetable Oil and turn on medium heat, then use a metal spatula to spread the oil up the sides of the wok.
Add Minced Garlic and stir occasionally until it begins to change color.
Add sauce mix set aside earlier and bring it to a boil for 3 minutes.
Add Green Beans and stir until they are thinly covered in sauce.
Stir every few minutes, carefully scraping sauce and garlic from the wok and the Green Beans are freshly covered with sauce.
Continue until Green Beans are cooked to desired amount. (20-30 minutes)

Modifications.modification: If you do not have a wok, use a large pot.
When Green Beans are nearly finished cooking, add 2 freshly chopped Scallions.
When Green Beans are finished cooking, add 1 Tablespoon Sesame Seeds and stir well.
If Di is not going to be eating them, double the amount of Ginger.
